record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, MARCH 7, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m. Wednesday morning, March 7; that on Wednesday following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of the proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed to have expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then return to S. 4 and the McCaskill amendment No. 315 and the Collins amendment No. 342 and debate them concurrently until 10 a.m., with the time equally divided and controlled between Senators McCaskill and Collins or their designees, and that no amendments be in order to either amendment prior to the vote; that at 10 a.m., without further intervening action or debate, the Senate proceed to vote in relation to the McCaskill amendment; that upon

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
